Description:
Detects suspicious reconnaissance command line activity on Windows systems using Net.EXE
Check if the user that executed the commands is suspicious (e.g. service accounts, LOCAL_SYSTEM)


Author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), omkar72, @svch0st, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Suspicious Group And Account Reconnaissance Activity Using Net.EXE
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where (((process_path like '%\net.exe' or process_path like '%\net1.exe') and (original_file_name = 'net.exe' or original_file_name = 'net1.exe')) and ((((command like '%domain admins%' or command like '% administrator%' or command like '% administrateur%' or command like '%enterprise admins%' or command like '%Exchange Trusted Subsystem%' or command like '%Remote Desktop Users%' or command like '%Utilisateurs du Bureau Ã  distance%' or command like '%Usuarios de escritorio remoto%' or command like '% /do%') and (command like '% group %' or command like '% localgroup %')) and  not command like '% /add%') or (command like '% accounts %' and command like '% /do%')))
